model.cargo
Class Truck

java.lang.Object
  model.cargo.MovableObject
      model.cargo.Truck

public class Truck
extends MovableObject

This class represents a truck, being the front part of a trailer and not the trailer itself. The trailer is represented in the Trailer class A truck used to be able to be moved disregarding the rest of the trip information but now trips are considered, so there are a couple of legacy methods from the previous implementation

Version:
April 2010
Author:
Jorge Alexis Hernandez

Constructor Detail

Truck

public Truck(java.lang.String truckId)
Default constructor, the other one is advised

Parameters:
truckId - the Id of the truck

Truck

public Truck(java.lang.String ID,
             Route routex)
This constructor is usually used whenever there are some unknown data in the truck, which will be later filled in. In cases where you have the data the next one is advised

Parameters:
ID - truck ID
routex - the route the truck is in

Truck

public Truck(java.lang.String ID,
             Driver driver,
             Route routex,
             int startTime,
             int numSegments)
This is the most complete of the constructor, this is the constructor advised in most of the circumstances.

Parameters:
ID - truck id
driver - driver reference for this truck
routex - route the truck is on
startTime - time at which the truck starts moving
numSegments - number of segments in the route
Method Detail

isMoving

public boolean isMoving()
This method checks if the truck is moving

Overrides:
isMoving in class MovableObject
Returns:
true: if it is moving false: otherwise

setCurrent

public void setCurrent(Segment current)
sets the current segment

Parameters:
current - segment to be set as the current one

start

public void start()
sets the current segment to the first one in the route and sets the Truck moving if testing: prints the route

onLastSegment

public boolean onLastSegment()
checks if the truck is on the last segment of the associated route

Returns:
true: if the current segment is the last segment false: otherwise

advanceSegment

public void advanceSegment()
Calling this method advances the truck to the next segment, it's the abstraction of movement. It moves the truck to the following segment and signals arrival if the truck was on the last segment and just arrived if stoped no movement, if slowed movement every two calls

stop

public void stop()
stops the truck

resume

public void resume()
resumes movement if the truck was stopped

slow

public void slow()
slows the truck, a slowed truck moves once every two calls to the movement

pace

public void pace()
un-slows the truck, returning the speed to the original one

hasArrived

public boolean hasArrived()
Returns:
true: if the truck arrived finished last segment. false: otherwise.

Returns:
reference to the current segment

getLastSegment

public Segment getLastSegment()
Returns:
A reference to the last segment in the truck's route

getNextSegment

public Segment getNextSegment()
Returns:
the next segment if the current one is not the last one, if it is returns null
